column1: Condoms are the best choice for preventing STIs.
The provider will determine the correct type and size of diaphragm for the woman.
- About 5 to 20 pregnancies occur over 1 year in 100 women using this method, depending on proper use.
In rare cases, toxic shock syndrome may develop in women who leave the diaphragm in too long.

VAGINAL SPONGE: - Vaginal contraceptive sponges are soft, and contain a chemical that kills or "disables "sperm. - The sponge is moistened and inserted into the vagina, to cover over the cervix before intercourse. - The vaginal sponge can be bought at your pharmacy without a prescription. HORMONAL METHODS OF BIRTH CONTROL Some birth control methods use hormones. They will have either both an estrogen and a progestin, or a progestin alone. You need a prescription for most hormonal birth control methods. - Both hormones prevent a woman's ovary from releasing an egg during her cycle. They do this by affecting the levels of other hormones the body makes. - Progestins help prevent sperm from making their way to the egg by making mucus around a woman's cervix thick and sticky. Types of hormonal birth control methods include: - Birth control pills: These may contain both estrogen and progestin, or only progestin.
- Progestin injections, such as Depo-Provera, that are given into the muscles of the upper arm or buttocks once every 3 months.
- The skin patch, such as Ortho Evra, is placed on your shoulder, buttocks, or other place on the body.
PERMANENT METHODS OF BIRTH CONTROL These methods are best for men, women, and couples who feel certain they do not want to have children in the future.
BIRTH CONTROL METHODS THAT DO NOT WORK VERY WELL - Withdrawal of the penis from the vagina before ejaculation can still result in pregnancy.
Douching is never recommended because it can cause infections in the uterus and tubes.
